meanings.definition: Not capable of producing offspring or crops.
meanings.sent1: The dry desert land was unfertile, unable to grow any plants.
meanings.sent2: The farmer avoided the unfertile soil for planting his crops.
meanings.sent3: The unfertile ground seemed to mock the gardener's efforts to grow flowers.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt unfertile, unable to generate any new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The unfertile field lay barren, devoid of any signs of life.

meanings.sent1: The unfertile land yielded no harvest for the villagers.
meanings.sent2: The unfertile region struggled to support any vegetation.
meanings.sent3: The unfertile garden soil seemed to play a prank on the gardener.
meanings.sent4: His unfertile efforts at work led to no progress in the project.
meanings.sent5: The unfertile tree stood alone, unable to bear any fruit.
